name: Bear Grylls' Poop Menu
description: This is a catch-all category for quality-of-life improvements available in modded Minecraft. This is stuff you want to pay attention to when you switch to a "real" modpack that might have quests of its own. These little tips and tricks can save you a lot of trouble before you hit post-scarcity.

quests.name: The Fabric Of Our Lives
quests.description: Cotton is a farmable resource for string and wool. Don't ask how cotton turns into wool. It's Minecraft magic! Anyways, this is great way to make bags and items before you get your hands on leather. Don't trivialize it. You actually want to start farming this first! If you can't find cotton plants in the wild, go on a grass punching spree and you'll eventually net some cotton seeds.

tasks.longDescription: I want 8 cotton to show you've put some thought into it!

quests.name: Have A Berry Good Time
quests.description: Natura provides berries: raspberries, blackberries, blueberries, and malobarries. They are individually nutritionally weak. You have to farm a ton of them. However, they grow like mad. The most important part is you can slap a berry bush inside your base, on dirt, without a water source, and they will thrive! One bush will turn into three. I recommend setting up a wall of them. You can run down the line of them and go nuts . . . er, go berries!

tasks.longDescription: It's your dumb luck that you'll find raspberries when you are playing, but they are really common. Keep looking! You will eventually need all four kinds, and maloberries are the hardest. Hence, they are the quest reward.

quests.name: Hang In There!
quests.description: The hang glider is a lazy way to move from place-to-place if you can get up on a mountain somewhere. It requires an odd amount of leather, so be prepared to cook down some zombie flesh! Seriously, making a hang glider out of leather is kind of creepy. :(

quests.name: Harvest All The Berries!
quests.description: If you combine all four types of berries together, you can make a berry medley. This is actually a pretty satisfying meal. This is useful in other modpacks that have jumbled up the hunger part of the game a little bit.

tasks.longDescription: This may take some time, but you will have 2/4 of the berry types before you hit this quest due to previous rewards. Now it's a game of finding blackberries and blueberries. They are fairly common.

quests.name: Hipster Torches
quests.description: There are now a few different ways to make torches. The most important thing to know is you can make torches from stone rods. This is very useful when you are deep underground and run out of torches. You probably have found some coal, so you just make some rods out of cobblestone, and you can keep on mining. Alternate fuel sources now include rubber and ... burnt sugar. Yeah.

tasks.longDescription: The one obnoxious thing about stone rods is you'll have to run the stone through a furnace first. You probably have enough cobblestone to do this, so don't fuss it too much.
You can burn some sugar--or just use some rubber--as fuel for torches.

quests.name: Dividing By Diamond
quests.description: The division sigil opens up a few fun tools and toys. You can normally find these as dungeon loot. Since this is a tutorial modpack, I am not going to wait for you to find one, and just give you a division sigil here. However, it is not yet activated, which is a pain in the butt. You want to look this one up online. I will wait. You have to wrap a block in redstone, wait until midnight, slap an animal on the altar, and kill it. Then all hell breaks loose. But don't do it quite yet!

quests.name: Before The Sacrifice!
quests.description: When you trigger "the sacrifice," a bolt will come down and start turning all the dirt around the altar into "cursed earth." This spawns tougher versions of regular monsters and spawns them much more quickly than other surfaces. You want this dirt for a mob farm! Prepare a shovel with silk touch so you can harvest it intact.

tasks.longDescription: The silk touch gem requires an emerald and a pile of string. String? Hey, how about that cotton farm?

quests.name: This Sin-Cursed Earth
quests.description: You really only need one cursed earth block. So long as you place it in darkness--free from the sun, it will spread to surrounding dirt tiles. Monsters then are much more likely to spawn on it. This is great for a mob farm!

quests.name: Power Gloves
quests.description: This glove can be upgraded. In fact, the upgrades you place on it boost any tools you use while wearing them. So you should slap tons of redstone on them! This makes your mining and bow draw speeds faster!

tasks.longDescription: All it takes is some leather.

quests.name: Jerky You Around
quests.description: In this modpack, making jerky is a waste of time. However, the hip challenge modpacks have a hunger mod that requires you eat a variety of foods to stay nourished. Jerky lets you draw out animal food sources just that little bit extra. To make jerky, build the jerky racks, then right click on them while holding a raw meat. They will then slowly turn into jerky over some time.

tasks.longDescription: Make a pile of these since meat takes some time to turn into jerky.

quests.name: Crawling In My Skin
quests.description: One of the best quality-of-life mods simply adds a recipe to convert zombie flesh into leather by running it through a furnace. Most good modpacks do this. Some don't because it's "unrealistic." Think about that for a minute. Watch a video on how leather is really made and you will find something that has no mod to do in Minecraft. So instead of punching cows for leather, you can punch zombies for leather.

tasks.longDescription: I can't specifically enforce that you actually did the quest, but please just pay attention. When you get some rotten flesh, run it through a vanilla furnace--or any furnace for that matter--and get leather from it. What else were you going to do with it? Eat it?

I specifically made sure this made it into the pack for the original teambuilding exercise at work for which I made the pack in the first place. I had some folks from India that I was afraid would not want to punch cows for leather. When we started playing, they gleefully were pushing cows into lava pits and doing all kinds of crap to them. Then I found out they were from Pakistan. And somehow I am the terrible person for mistaking where they were from.

quests.name: Bikini Bottom Visitor Kit
quests.description: Let's say you want to walk along the botton of the ocean. Maybe you want to build an undersea dome. Maybe you're playing a different modpack that doesn't spray clay, sand, and gravel everywhere? I have just the thing! Artifice provides armor upgrades that act like targeted enchantments. Take a fresh, sturdy helmet, put it in a crafting grid with these upgrades, one-at-a-time, and you can suddenly tolerate the ocean much more.

tasks.longDescription: These upgrades can be stacked, so if the original results are too weak, just apply more upgrades. I recommend reserving a special helmet for this that you only wear when going underwater. I will give you an armor stand so you can put it in a prominent spot.

quests.name: Working At A Reasonable Clip
quests.description: It is so nice of me to lay out all the things you have to do to progress in the pack. You will not always have that luxury. Heck, you might be playing this on a server with friends logging in at different times, and nobody knows what's up. Maybe they text you or something to ask what to do. To keep you all from having to actually talk to each other like normal, social human beings, try the clipboard. You can lay out lists of tasks that have to be done, and then you can mark them off.

tasks.longDescription: Making one of these requires squid ink, so you will probably have to wade into a body of water and squish a squid. You will also need a chicken feather, which you may have coincidentally tripped across already. The clipboard can be erased and reused, so this isn't too steep a cost.

quests.name: Not Your Average Ladder
quests.description: Ladders are a fine thing to have, but it can get annoying to use them on long trips. OpenBlocks' elevators are a better option for your base, but another pack might not have them, or that pack may charge you your XP to use it, for some dumb reason. An alternative is a dark steel ladder. Getting to dark steel tech will take a little bit of a fuss with EnderIO, but if you play with that mod in this pack, you get a ladder you can climb and descend at twice the normal rate.

tasks.longDescription: You can use dark steel for tools and such, but their quality can be matched from cheaper materials. So other than for EnderIO-specific things, I just use it for ladders. You make some, and I will just give you a stack of them.
